1.verse: Paul and Silvanus and Timothy to the church of the Thessalonians in God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ:

2.verse: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

3.verse: We Thank God For Your Faith And Love, And Boast of Your Endurance Amidst Afflictions - We ought to be giving-thanks to God always for you, brothers, just as it is fitting, because your faith is growing-abundantly and the love of each one of you all toward one another is increasing,

4.verse: so that we ourselves are boasting in you among the churches of God with reference to your endurance and faith in all your persecutions and afflictions which you are bearing-with—

5.verse: These Are Evidence of God’s Righteous Judgment Concerning You And Those Afflicting You - ... which is evidence of the righteous judgment of  God that you will be considered-worthy of the kingdom of God for the sake of which you also are suffering,

6.verse: since it will be a righteous thing with God to repay affliction to the ones afflicting you

7.verse: and to give you, the ones being afflicted, rest along with us at the revelation of the Lord Jesus from heaven with angels of  His power

8.verse: in flaming fire, giving punishment to the ones not knowing God and the ones not obeying the good-news of our Lord Jesus—

9.verse: who will pay the penalty: eternal destruction from the presence of the Lord and from the glory of  His strength,

10.verse: when He comes to be glorified in His saints and marveled-at  among all the ones having believed— because our testimony to you was believed— on that day,

11.verse: We Pray For God To Fulfill Your Every Desire To Express Your Goodness And Faith - ... for which also we are praying always for you in order that our God may consider you worthy of the calling, and may fulfill every desire of goodness and work of  faith with [His] power,

12.verse: so that the name of our Lord Jesus may be glorified in you and you in Him, according-to the grace of our God and the Lord Jesus Christ.

1.verse: Now Don’t Be Alarmed: The Day of The Lord Has Not Yet Come - Now we ask you, brothers, concerning the coming of our Lord Jesus Christ and our gathering-together to Him,

2.verse: that you not be quickly shaken from your understanding nor alarmed— neither by a spirit, nor by a word, nor by a letter as-if through us, how that the day of the Lord is present.

3.verse: Let no one deceive you in any way, because it will not be present unless the apostasy comes first and the man of lawlessness is revealed— the son of  destruction,

4.verse: the one opposing and exalting himself over everything being called god or an object-of-worship, so that he sits-down in the temple of God displaying himself that he is god.

5.verse: Do you not remember that while still being with you I was telling you these things?

6.verse: And you know the thing restraining now, so that he might be revealed in his own time.

7.verse: For Lawlessness Is Being Restrained Right Now, But The Lawless One Will Come Later - For the mystery of lawlessness is already at-work, only there is the one restraining right-now until he comes out of the midst.

8.verse: And then the lawless one will be revealed, whom the Lord Jesus will kill with the breath of His mouth and do-away-with by the appearance of His coming—

9.verse: whose coming is in accordance with the working of Satan, with all power and signs and wonders of  falsehood,

10.verse: and with every deception of  unrighteousness for the ones perishing because they did not receive the love of the truth so that they might be saved.

11.verse: And for this reason, God sends them a working of  error so that they will believe the falsehood,

12.verse: in order that all the ones not having believed in the truth but having taken-pleasure in unrighteousness may be condemned.

13.verse: But God Chose You To Be The Firstfruits of Salvation. Stand Firm And Hold On To The Truth - But we ought to be giving-thanks to God always for you, brothers having been loved by the Lord, because God chose you to be the firstfruit for salvation in the holiness of  the Spirit and faith in the truth—

14.verse: to which also He called you through our good-news, for the obtaining of the glory of our Lord Jesus Christ.

15.verse: So then, brothers, be standing-firm, and be holding-on-to the traditions which you were taught— whether by word [of mouth] or by our letter.

16.verse: And may our Lord Jesus Christ Himself and God our Father, the One having loved us and having given us eternal comfort and good hope by grace,

17.verse: comfort your hearts and establish you in every good work and word.

1.verse: Pray That The Word May Spread Quickly And That We May Be Protected From Evil People - Finally, brothers, be praying for us that the word of the Lord may run and be glorified, just as also with you,

2.verse: and that we may be delivered from out-of-place and evil people. For faith is not possessed by everyone.

3.verse: But the Lord is faithful— Who will establish you, and protect you from the evil one.

4.verse: And we are confident in the Lord concerning you that the things which we are commanding, you also are doing and will do.

5.verse: And may the Lord direct your hearts into the love of  God and into the endurance of  Christ.

6.verse: Imitate Us, And Keep Away From Those Who Don’t - Now we command you, brothers, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ, that you be keeping-away from every brother walking disorderly and not according to the tradition which they received from us.

7.verse: For you yourselves know how you ought-to be imitating us. Because we were not disorderly among you,

8.verse: nor did we eat bread as-a-gift from anyone, but were working with labor and hardship by night and by day so-as not to be a burden-on any of you—

9.verse: not because we do not have the right, but in order that we might give ourselves as a pattern to you, so that you may be imitating us.

10.verse: For even when we were with you, we commanded this to you— that “if anyone does not want to work, neither let him eat”.

11.verse: For we are hearing of some among you walking disorderly, not working at all, but being-busybodies.

12.verse: Now to such ones we command and exhort in the Lord Jesus Christ that while working with quietness, they eat their own bread.

13.verse: But you, brothers, do not grow-weary while doing-good.

14.verse: And if anyone does not obey our word through this letter, be taking-note-of  this one— to not be associating-with him, in order that he may be ashamed.

15.verse: And do not be regarding him as an enemy, but be admonishing him as a brother.

16.verse: And may the Lord of peace Himself give you peace continually in every way. The Lord be with you all.

17.verse: The greeting of Paul by my own hand, which is a sign in every letter— I write in this manner.

18.verse: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all.
